info.title: Systemprompt Prompt Management API
info.description: API for managing prompts, blocks, tools, and users

servers.description: Production server V1 of the API

get.description: Retrieves a list of all available prompts.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items per page

post.description: Creates a new prompt with the provided details.

get.description: Retrieves the details of a prompt by its UUID.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: UUID of the prompt to retrieve

put.description: Updates an existing prompt with the provided details.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: UUID of the prompt to update

delete.description: Deletes a prompt by its UUID.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: UUID of the prompt to delete

post.description: Generates a prompt with the provided payload.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: UUID of the prompt to execute

examples.message: Please analyze this text and provide feedback.

post.description: Runs a prompt using OpenAI model

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: UUID of the prompt to execute

examples.message: Please analyze this text and provide feedback.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all available conversations.

parameters.description: Page number for pagination

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items per page

post.description: Creates a new conversation with the provided details.

parameters.name: uuid

static.description: Static content is content that is usually rendered first in the prompt and remains consistent between uses. This enables the use of caching, and referring to stored context such as documents or referenced content
examples: You are a world class journalist. Analyse the research and create an amazing blog, use the content for information {{referenced_content}}

state.description: State is content that is persisted between different calls to a LLM, typically referring to conversation history or referring to previously generated output.

dynamic.description: Dynamic content is content that is provided at runtime. Typically this will be a message or structured data that is used by the AI to generate the output. Changes on each use.

examples: This is a schema that accepts structured data or messages

reference.description: Referenced node for the input schema

schema.description: JSON Schema definition for structured data. Required if type is structured_data. Must be type `object`.
JSON Schema definition for structured data. Required if type is structured_data. Must be type `object`.

examples: This is a schema that accepts structured data or messages

reference.description: Referenced node for the output schema

schema.description: JSON Schema definition for structured data. Required if type is structured_data. Must be type `object`.
JSON Schema definition for structured data. Required if type is structured_data. Must be type `object`.

examples: A schema for analysing research data for blogs

PromptExecutionResult.description: The result of the LLM execution.

structured_data.description: The structured data output from the LLM. Must be Valid JSON7Schema

examples: Please analyze this text and provide feedback.

ApiKeyAuth.name: api-key
ApiKeyAuth.description: This is a required API key. It must be included in the header of all requests in the format: api-key: value.
